Welcome to QuDiPy’s documentation!

About:

  • QuDiPy (Quantum Dots in Python)

Modules:

  • QuDiPy
    • Modules

Tutorials:

  • Using the charge stability module
    • 1. Add the current location to path
    • 2. Import the relevant modules and set plotting parameters
    • 3. Specify the capacitance of the system you wish to simulate and then initialize the charge stability diagram object
    • 4. Generate the charge stability diagram
    • 5. Plot the resulting diagram
    • 6. Find the edges of the charge stability diagram
    • 7. Create bitmap from edge data
    • 8. Perform the Hough transform
    • 9. Peak Finding & Clustering
    • 10. Extracting Triple Points
  • Electron Shuttling
    • 1. Load relevant modules and add the current location to path
    • 2. Load potential files
    • 3. Building the shuttling control pulse
    • 4. Evolving over time
    • 5. Sweeping pulse lengths
  • Solving Single Electron Schrödinger Equation
    • 1. First load the relevant modules and initialize SimulationParameters
    • 2a. 1D Schrödinger equation: initialize GridParameters class
    • 2b. 1D Schrödinger equation: use qutils to solve schrodinger equation
    • 2c. Check results
    • 3b. 2D Schrödinger equation: use qutils to solve schrodinger equation
    • 3c. Check results
  • Using the Stark shift module
    • 1. Add the current location to path
    • 2. Import the relevant modules
    • 3. Define the potential
    • 4. Define the electric field
    • 5. Calculate wavefunctions
    • 6. Calculate Stark shift
